billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Provides that the state policy with regard to the alcoholic beverage control law shall be to promote economic development in the beer, wine and liquor industries
summary: Provides that the state policy with regard to the alcoholic beverage control law shall be to promote economic development and job opportunities in the beer, wine and liquor industries of the state.

       AN ACT to amend the alcoholic beverage control law, in relation  to  the
         state policy with regard to alcoholic beverages

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 2 of the alcoholic beverage control law, as amended
    2  by chapter 111 of the laws of 1978, is amended to read as follows:
    3    S 2. Policy of state and purpose of chapter.  It is hereby declared as
    4  the policy of the state that it is necessary to regulate and control the
    5  manufacture, sale and distribution within the state of alcoholic  bever-
    6  ages  for  the  purpose  of  fostering and promoting temperance in their
    7  consumption and respect for and obedience to law. It is hereby  declared
    8  that  such  policy  will  best  be  carried out by empowering the liquor
    9  authority of the state  to  determine  whether  public  convenience  and
   10  advantage  will  be  promoted  by the issuance of licenses to traffic in
   11  alcoholic beverages, the increase or decrease in the number thereof  and
   12  the  location of premises licensed thereby, subject only to the right of
   13  judicial review [hereinafter] provided for IN THIS CHAPTER.    IN  ADDI-
   14  TION,  IT  IS  DECLARED  AS THE POLICY OF THIS STATE TO PROMOTE ECONOMIC
   15  DEVELOPMENT AND JOB OPPORTUNITIES BY PROMOTING THE EXPANSION AND PROFIT-
   16  ABILITY OF THE BEER, WINE  AND  LIQUOR  PRODUCTION  INDUSTRIES  IN  THIS
   17  STATE.   PROMOTING SUCH BEER, WINE AND LIQUOR PRODUCTION INDUSTRIES WILL
   18  FOSTER GROWTH IN THIS STATE'S TOURISM  INDUSTRY;  PROMOTE  CONSERVATION,
   19  PRODUCTION  AND  ENHANCEMENT  OF  STATE AGRICULTURAL LANDS; AND MAKE THE
   20  STATE'S ECONOMY MORE SELF-RELIANT IN THE PRODUCTION  OF  FOOD  AND  FOOD
   21  RELATED  PRODUCTS.  It is the purpose of this chapter to carry out [that
   22  policy] THESE POLICIES in the public interest. The [restrictions,] regu-
   23  lations and provisions contained in this  chapter  are  enacted  by  the
   24  legislature  for  the  protection,  health,  welfare  [and],  safety AND
   25  ECONOMIC WELL-BEING of the people of the state.
   26    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1515

TITLE OF BILL:

An act
to amend the alcoholic beverage control law, in relation to the state
policy with regard to alcoholic beverages

PURPOSE:

To update the overall articulated state public policy regarding the
regulation of the manufacture of alcoholic beverages in New York.
This policy was first articulated by the New York State Legislature
when adopting the first Alcoholic Beverage Control Law after repeal
of the 18th Amendment (Prohibition) to the United States Constitution
in 1933.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:

Section 1: Amends Alcoholic Beverage Control Law section 2 "Policy of
state and purpose of chapter". This amendment adds that the policy of
the State Liquor Authority is to also consider promoting the economic
development and job opportunities of this State when pursuing its
regulatory activities with regard to the State's beer, wine, and
liquor production industries. This policy consideration is in
addition to the already articulated policy to control the manufacture
of alcoholic beverages in this State.

EXISTING LAW:

Under current law, the State Liquor Authority, in its activities, is
to consider the control of the manufacture and sale of alcoholic
beverages without any consideration to the economic benefits and job
creation possibilities that are derived from promoting activities
that relate to the manufacture of beer, wine and liquors.

JUSTIFICATION:

The overall environment in which the regulation of the manufacture,
sales and consumption of alcoholic beverages has changed greatly
since the public policy statement contained in section 2 of the
Alcoholic Beverage Control Law was first adopted in 1933. Since,
1933, the Great Depression is over, the Allied Forces won the Second
World War, and the Cold War is now over. Further, consumer
preferences and consumption patterns for alcoholic beverages have
changed significantly since the policy statement contained in Section
2 was adopted over 85 years ago.

It is now time to modernize the overall policy with regard to
regulating the manufacture of alcoholic beverages so that its
reflects the social
benefits that can be derived to the State of New York by encouraging
the production of quality beer, wine, and spirits. Expanding
production facilities that manufacture beer, wine, and liquors in
this State can increase the demand for state produced agricultural
crops, preserve working farms and open spaces, minimize future real


property tax increases, and promote economic opportunities related to
agri-tourism industries.

This bill will give regulators the tools that they need to consider
the economic development and job opportunities that can be created by
promoting the prudent expansion of the manufacture of beer, wines,
and liquors.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2008: A.10314 Referred to Economic Development
2010: A.6184Referred to Investigations & Government Operations

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

LOCAL FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediate.
